benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to bundle

covered: PUT - Valid Request: Multiple happy-path scenarios validate successful updates (204) with required and optional headers.
PUT - Non-Existing Resource: 404 for nonexistent bundleId is covered.
PUT - Invalid Inputs: 400s for invalid bundleId format, malformed JSON, missing body, and missing required header.
Schema Validation: Unsupported fields in body return 400.
Header Handling: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy validated; optional X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment exercised.
State Variations: Updates when no existing custom fields, when updating existing fields, and when removing all fields (empty array).
Edge Cases: Maximum number of custom fields, max value length, empty values, special characters regression.
Security Negative: SQL injection-like payload rejected with 400.
Reliability/Resilience: Transient failure retry succeeds; dependency failures mapped to 503/500.
Load/Performance: Normal and peak load scenarios validate 204 and response time.
URL Robustness: Unexpected query parameter tolerated without breaking core behavior.
gaps: PUT - Concurrency Control: No scenarios to detect/update conflicts (e.g., last-writer-wins vs optimistic locking, 409 with If-Match/ETag or version).

PUT - Partial Update Policy: Story does not state if partial updates are allowed; tests assume they are. Add scenarios to ensure partial updates are rejected if not allowed, or explicitly verify allowed behavior per API spec.
Content Negotiation: No tests for incorrect/missing Content-Type (e.g., 415) or unacceptable Accept header (e.g., 406), despite produces/consumes being specified.
Idempotency: No test to verify repeated identical PUTs produce the same final state and consistent status code.

Validation Depth: Missing tests for invalid CustomField schema details (e.g., missing required properties, wrong data types, invalid key/name format, null values, too-long values beyond max, exceeding max number should error).
Auditability: No verification that X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment are persisted to audit logs/history.
Error Body Contracts: While status codes are asserted, there is no strict validation of error response schema (codes, messages, error types).
UUID Pattern Enforcement: Only a generic invalid string is tested; no explicit test of the documented UUID regex pattern and boundary cases (uppercase/lowercase, hyphen positions).
Large Payload Handling: No tests for very large but valid bodies within limits vs exceeding server limits (payload size leading to 413).
Rate Limiting/Throttling: Under peak load, no assertion about hitting or not hitting rate limits (429), if applicable to this API.
recommendations: Add concurrency tests: two concurrent PUTs with conflicting updates; if optimistic locking is supported, include If-Match/ETag and expect 409 on stale version; otherwise document last-writer-wins and verify final state.

Clarify and test partial update behavior: if PUT replaces the full set, send a partial array and expect rejection (400/422); if allowed, verify only specified fields change and unspecified remain intact.
Add content negotiation tests: missing/incorrect Content-Type -> 415; unacceptable Accept header -> 406; with 204, still verify headers are appropriate.
Add idempotency test: apply the same PUT twice and verify state unchanged and response consistent (204).

Expand validation coverage: cases with missing required CustomField properties, invalid data types, nulls, keys with invalid characters, value length exceeding max -> 400/422; exceeding maximum count -> 400/422.
Verify audit fields: after successful update, retrieve audit/history to confirm X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment are recorded.
Define and assert error response schema: validate error code, message, and type fields for 400/404/500/503/401 consistently.
Strengthen UUID tests: cover boundary/case sensitivity and exact hyphen placement per regex pattern.
Test large payload behavior: near-limit payload succeeds within performance bounds; beyond-limit returns 413 with descriptive error.
Consider rate limiting behavior under sustained peak load: validate 429 if limits apply, or explicitly verify absence of throttling for this endpoint if not applicable.
